Hi!


> If you want the manufacturer to provide test data there is a european 
> standard that describes a blind measurement procedure for hemispherical 
> transmission.  I don't know the standard number, but perhaps someone 
> else on the list knows what it is?  This procedure only measures values 
> for normal incidence though.


You would probably end up doing a full measurement of the bidirectional 
reflection / transmission distribution. Then you could use the data to 
e.g. fit a trans material to it. The normal incidence alone is not 
really suitable to reflect the incident distribution for a window...


Cheers, Lars.
